lead_paragraph: Chris Solinsky failed last night in his bid for a third consecutive N.C.A.A. indoor 3,000-meter title. Instead, he had to settle for being part of Wisconsin’s first national championship team. Solinsky finished second to Northern Arizona’s Lopez Lomong in the 3,000, giving Wisconsin a comfortable lead over Texas and Florida State. The Badgers ended the meet with 40 points. Florida State was second with 35. Arizona State won its first women’s indoor title with 38 points, 5 more than L.S.U.
